instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Not Booting into any OS
threads.message: I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B that powers on fine and begins loading the Apple logo with loading bar underneath. It takes a while, and then white screens after loading about 75% of OS. Immediately after white screening, the entire macbook shuts off and needs to be rebooted (although occasionally it bootloops in this fashion). Have tried booting into an eternal OS as well a diag drive, but it again white screens after selecting one of the options to boot. Motherboard appears to be clear of any obvious corrosion/physical damage, and there is no known liquid exposure that I am aware of. Any thoughts?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Not Booting into any OS
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Not Booting into any OS
threads.message: You could replace the GPU, but yeah good luck finding REAL NEW ones.
